event.title: was surveyed in the fall of 1835

data.event: The town was surveyed in the fall of 1835 with Sterling C. Robertson as its founder.
In January 1836, the settlement was attacked by Indians in the area.

event.title: was also designated the seat of justice for Milam municipality in 1836

data.event: Nashville was also designated the seat of justice for Milam municipality in 1836.
It began to slowly decline after 1846, when the state legislature moved the county seat to Cameron.

event.title: 1868, the arrival of the Houston and Texas Central Railroad at nearby Hearne provided

data.event: In 1868, the arrival of the Houston and Texas Central Railroad at nearby Hearne provided the remaining residents with the incentive to move.
